review_blob: I tried this for the first time at Denver Festivus but I had so many different beers I forgot if I liked it, so we bought a 6 pack.. Not my favorite. Apparently they tried to mate a wheat beer and an IPA in order to get a beer you can drink all year long... I drink IPAs all year long, I do not care for wheat beers--and apparently I do not like my IPAs diluted with wheat beer. The color is gold and clear, light on the tongue and in alcohol. The aroma is a little bit of bread and a little bit of citrus. Not very hoppy, takes more of the wheat flavor profile.

The color is golden with a light white head. The fruity/citrus aroma helps soften the strong hops of the IPA but it still has a bit of bitterness which I personally enjoy. I dont taste many of the things that some people on here have included in their reviews, those sound disgusting. This was quite enjoyable and I would buy it again. I did see someone mention inconsistency at DBC so maybe I gota different/better batch.
This is one of my favorites from DBC. The appearance is a dark brown with a light tan head. The aroma is a toasty chocolate and vanilla. The taste is of chocolate and vanill. Its like a malty smore.

This beer is dangerous! Probably the easiest drinking triple IPA that I have ever tasted. Although it is heavy on the hops and high alcohol content, it is not as thick/sticky as most and has a slight citrus flavor. Too smooth for your sobriety.

This was the first beer I tried at Renegade and I think it is pretty solid stout. Sometimes you dont need something that is bourbon barrel or oak aged. This has the aroma of chocolate, vanilla and coffee. Although very dark roasted the chocolate and vanilla smooth out the bitterness of the roast. A full bodied beer with a dry finish at the end.
beer_name: Renegade Hammer & Sickle Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Let me preface this with--I really dislike Belgian Hops, I am also not the biggest fan of pumpkin beers, so this beer had an uphill battle. That being said this is the first Farmhouse Ale I have ever had that I could actually drink a full pour of. The citrus and nutmeg balance the pumpkin. This beer is light on the tongue with a nice orange peel finish.

Aroma- citrus; Appearance- a hazy golden color; Taste- light citrus with a light hoppy flavor which balances it out quite nicely; Palate- light on the tongue with a smooth almost creamy finish; There is a light citrus flavor from the orange peel,

Had this at the brewery and took a growler of it home. Appearance-Dark black pour with a thin light tan head. Left slight lacing on the glass. Aroma- dark chocolate, curry spices, roasted malt. Taste- flavors align with aroma, with neither the chocolate or the curry over powering the overall taste. Palate was medium to full bodied-not thick or sticky, but smooth with a nice warm curry finish.
